panel-0.title: Train Compartment
panel-0.content: You are in the train compartment where the murder occurred. The victim, Mr. Archibald, lies on the floor, a knife protruding from his chest. Passengers are in shock, and the train has come to a halt.

panel-1.title: Examine the Body
panel-1.content: The victim is Mr. Archibald, a wealthy businessman. A knife is lodged in his chest, and there are signs of a struggle. His watch is missing.

panel-2.title: Interview Passengers
panel-2.content: You start interviewing the passengers. They seem nervous and eager to clear their names. You notice a few suspicious behaviors.

panel-3.title: Inspect the Surrounding Area
panel-3.content: You find a blood-stained obligation document near the window and a broken watch near the door. One name on the obligation belongs to Mr. Archibald, the other is illegible. The window is slightly open.

panel-4.title: Talk to Ms. Langford
panel-4.content: Ms. Langford is a young woman who seems particularly shaken. She claims she saw a shadowy figure leaving the compartment just before the train stopped.

panel-5.title: Talk to Mr. Hayes
panel-5.content: Mr. Hayes is a middle-aged man with a stern look. He insists he was in his own compartment the entire time and has no idea what happened.

panel-6.title: Talk to Mr. Chu
panel-6.content: Mr. Chu is a young, thin man. He claims that he saw Mr. Hayes sitting in his compartment while the attack happened. He also heard an argument concerning debt, between man and woman.

fact-1.title: Murder Weapon
fact-1.description: A knife is lodged in Mr. Archibald's chest.

fact-3.title: Blood-stained Obligation
fact-3.description: An obligation document with blood stains was found near the window. It has a name of Mr. Archibald and one other, illegible.

fact-4.title: Broken Watch
fact-4.description: A broken watch was found near the door.

fact-5.title: Shadowy Figure
fact-5.description: Ms. Langford saw a shadowy figure leaving the compartment.

fact-6.title: Mr. Hayes' Alibi
fact-6.description: Mr. Hayes claims he was in his own compartment the entire time.

fact-7.title: Suspicious Behavior
fact-7.description: Ms. Langford seemed particularly shaken and nervous.

fact-8.title: Watch Connection
fact-8.description: The broken watch found near the door belongs to Mr. Archibald.

fact-9.title: Window Clue
fact-9.description: The slightly open window suggests someone might have escaped through it.

fact-10.title: Nervous Ms. Langford
fact-10.description: Ms. Langford's nervousness and sighting of the shadowy figure make her a prime suspect.

fact-11.title: Alibi Doubt
fact-11.description: Mr. Hayes' stern demeanor and solid alibi raise doubts.

fact-12.title: Escape Route
fact-12.description: The open window suggests that the murderer might have escaped through it.

fact-13.title: Motive for Theft
fact-13.description: The missing watch suggests the murder might have been for theft.

fact-14.title: Ms. Langford's Debt
fact-14.description: Ms. Langford was in debt to Mr. Archibald.

fact-15.title: Mr. Hayes' Innocence
fact-15.description: Mr. Hayes' alibi is corroborated by Mr. Chu.

fact-17.title: Obligation Argument
fact-17.description: Mr. Chu heard an argument between man and woman, concerning obligation.

fact-19.title: Clear Mr. Hayes
fact-19.description: Mr. Hayes is cleared of suspicion due to corroborated alibi.

fact-20.title: Final Deduction
fact-20.description: Ms. Langford, in debt and desperate, murdered Mr. Archibald and escaped, leaving the blood-stained obligation behind.
